net.kuujo.vertigo.output

Interface OutputCollector


  • public interface OutputCollector
    An output collector.

    The output collector is the primary interface for emitting new messages from a component. When a new component instance is started, the output collector registers an event bus handler at the component address. This is the address at which other components publish listen requests. When a new listen request is received, the output collector sets up an output Channel and any new messages emitted from the component will be sent to the new channel as well.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • getAddress

        String getAddress()
        Returns the output address. This should be identical to a component address.
        Returns:
        The output address.

      • addHook

        OutputCollector addHook(OutputHook hook)
        Adds an output hook to the output collector.
        Parameters:
        hook - The hook to add.
        Returns:
        The called output collector instance.

      • emit

        MessageId emit(org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject body)
        Emits a new message to the default stream.
        Parameters:
        body - The message body.
        Returns:
        The unique output message correlation identifier. This identifier can be used to correlate new messages with the emitted message.

      • emit

        MessageId emit(org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject body,
             JsonMessage parent)
        Emits a child message to the default stream. Emitting data as the child of an existing message creates a new node in the parent message's message tree. When the new message is emitted, the auditor assigned to the parent message will be notified of the change, and the new message will be tracked as a child. This means that the parent message will not be considered fully processed until all of its children have been acked and are considered fully processed (their children are acked... etc). It is strongly recommended that users use this API whenever possible.
        Parameters:
        body - The message body.
        parent - The parent message of the data.
        Returns:
        The unique child message correlation identifier. This identifier can be used to correlate new messages with the emitted message.

      • emit

        MessageId emit(JsonMessage message)
        Emits a message to the default stream as a child of itself. This is useful when a message is simply passing through a component without any actual changes to its internal data, such as with message filtering. A new message will be created as a child of the given message. The new message will contain a copy of the given message body.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to emit.
        Returns:
        The new unique message correlation identifier.

      • emitTo

        MessageId emitTo(String stream,
               org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject body)
        Emits a new message to the default stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - The stream to which to emit the message.
        body - The message body.
        Returns:
        The unique output message correlation identifier. This identifier can be used to correlate new messages with the emitted message.

      • emitTo

        MessageId emitTo(String stream,
               org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject body,
               JsonMessage parent)
        Emits a child message to the default stream. Emitting data as the child of an existing message creates a new node in the parent message's message tree. When the new message is emitted, the auditor assigned to the parent message will be notified of the change, and the new message will be tracked as a child. This means that the parent message will not be considered fully processed until all of its children have been acked and are considered fully processed (their children are acked... etc). It is strongly recommended that users use this API whenever possible.
        Parameters:
        stream - The stream to which to emit the message.
        body - The message body.
        parent - The parent message of the data.
        Returns:
        The unique child message correlation identifier. This identifier can be used to correlate new messages with the emitted message.

      • emitTo

        MessageId emitTo(String stream,
               JsonMessage message)
        Emits a message to the default stream as a child of itself. This is useful when a message is simply passing through a component without any actual changes to its internal data, such as with message filtering. A new message will be created as a child of the given message. The new message will contain a copy of the given message body.
        Parameters:
        stream - The stream to which to emit the message.
        message - The message to emit.
        Returns:
        The new unique message correlation identifier.

      • ackHandler

        OutputCollector ackHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<MessageId> handler)
        Sets an ack handler on the output collector. This handler will be called with the correlation identifier of the message that was acked once a message completes processing.
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be invoked when an ack message is received.
        Returns:
        The called output collector instance.

      • failHandler

        OutputCollector failHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<MessageId> handler)
        Sets a fail handler on the output collector. This handler will be called with the correlation identifier of the message that was failed. Note that even if a descendant of the output message was failed, all parent and ancestor messages are failed as well, up to the root.
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be invoked when a fail message is received.
        Returns:
        The called output collector instance.

      • timeoutHandler

        OutputCollector timeoutHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<MessageId> handler)
        Sets a timeout handler on the output collector. This handler will be called with the correlation identifier of the message that timed out. Note that timeouts apply only to root messages, not children of other messages.
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be invoked when a message has timed out.
        Returns:
        The called output collector instance.

      • start

        OutputCollector start()
        Starts the output collector.
        Returns:
        The called output collector instance.

      • start

        OutputCollector start(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Starts the output collector.
        Parameters:
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be invoked once the collector is started.
        Returns:
        The called output collector instance.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the output collector.

      • stop

        void stop(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Stops the output collector.
        Parameters:
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be invoked once the collector is stopped.
